title: Shap values give additivity error with XGBoost when the parameters 'tree_method': 'hist' is set
body:
Hi @slundberg,

I have realized that when I train an XGBoost with the parameter **'tree_method': 'hist'** set, the **TreeExplainer.shap_values()** function fails with the error: **Exception: Additivity check failed in TreeExplainer!**. Here is a sample code I run where the last line gives the error I mentioned:

```
from xgboost.sklearn import XGBClassifier
import shap
params = {
    "eta": 0.05,
    "objective": "binary:logistic",
    "subsample": 0.5,
    "tree_method': 'hist"
}
model_xgb = XGBClassifier(**params)
model_xgb .fit(X_train, y_train)
explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model_xgb , data = X_test)
shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X_test)
```

Interestingly, if I do not pass the data when creating 'explainer':
`explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model_xgb )`
I do not get the error but the sum of shap values plus expected value does not match the 'raw' output of the model. I guess in that case, the feature_perturbation is set to "tree_path_dependent" and 'assert_additivity' is not checked in the code. 

In addition, if I want to get the shap values for the probabilities and use 
`explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model_xgb , data = X_test, model_output="probability")`
then I do not get an error but additivity of the shap values do not hold again when checked manually. 

All seems fine when I do not use **'tree_method': 'hist'** parameter and additivity works (and no errors). 

Do you have any insight why this might be the case?

Thank you,
Ulas.
